English: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, To the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints who are in all Achaia
Bahnar: Inh Pôl bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist, na nhi oh bơ̆n Timôthê chih hơpong kơ lu 'nhŏng oh bơngai lui tơ pơlei iĕm Kôrintô, lu mă 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk, hăm đĭ-đăng kơ lu kon 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆p kơ dêh Grĕk.

English: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Bahnar: Nhôn apinh 'Bă tơm bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist wei-lăng iĕm tôm tơdrong wă kơ Sư ăn kơ iĕm hiôk-hian ling-lang.

English: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort
Bahnar: Bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'Bă Yêsu Krist Yŏng bơ̆n, Sư 'Bă tơm bơ̆n 'mêm kơ bơ̆n dêh, Sư Kră Yang gơh pơlung bơ̆n tôm tơdrong kơplah bơ̆n đei tơdrong gleh truh pơmat-tat.

English: who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble, with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
Bahnar: Sư pơlung bơ̆n pơmat-tat wă kơ bơ̆n gơh pơlung lu bôl bơ̆n mă đei tơdrong pơmat-tat. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơlung bơ̆n thoi yơ, bơ̆n pơlung bôl thoi noh.

English: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also abounds through Christ.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơ̆n chu iŏk tơdrong pơmat-tat thoi Yêsu Krist, na Sư pơlung bơ̆n, wă kơ bơ̆n huay kơ sơ'ngon.

English: Now if we are afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effective for enduring the same sufferings which we also suffer. Or if we are comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.
Bahnar: Nhôn đei tơdrong pơmat-tat, 'noh nhôn adrin tơgŭm iĕm wă kơ iĕm hiôk păng klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. Nhôn đei 'Bok Kei-Dei pơlung pơhiôk jơhngơ̆m đon nhôn, wă kơ nhôn pơlung pơhiôk jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm, wă kơ iĕm pran jăng hli kơ iĕm mah đei tơdrong pơmat thoi nhôn.

English: And our hope for you is steadfast, because we know that as you are partakers of the sufferings, so also you will partake of the consolation.
Bahnar: Tơdrong lui kơjăp, nhôn băt kơ iĕm lui kơjăp tơpă. Yua kơ iĕm chu iŏk tơdrong pơmat-tat thoi nhôn, na 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m pơlung iĕm hiôk lei-lăi thoi nhôn mơ̆n.

English: For we do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, of our trouble which came to us in Asia: that we were burdened beyond measure, above strength, so that we despaired even of life.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, nhôn wă roi tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm gah tơdrong đe pơmat nhôn tơ dêh Asi. Nhôn pŭ pơmat trăp dêh, nhôn pă ngêh kơ arih boih.

English: Yes, we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves but in God who raises the dead
Bahnar: Nhôn tơchĕng gah lôch đĕch, mă-lei pơm huay huăi. Nhôn băt kơ tơdrong noh truh wă kơ nhôn huay kơ sơđơ̆ng kơ akâu kơdih, wă kơ nhôn gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch, yua kơ pôm Sư đĕch gơh tơiung arih kon bơngai.

English: who delivered us from so great a death, and does deliver us; in whom we trust that He will still deliver us
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng Sư ưh kơ tơdŏng nhôn, nhôn lôch tơpă boih. Mă Sư kư̆m oei wă tơdŏng nhôn kơnh pơgê đơ̆ng tôm tơdrong hli hlơt. Lu nhôn oei wă sơđơ̆ng kơ Sư tơdŏng nhôn ling-lang.

English: you also helping together in prayer for us, that thanks may be given by many persons on our behalf for the gift granted to us through many.
Bahnar: Iĕm krao khan tơgŭm nhôn hŏ, wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ nhôn đơ̆ng lơ bơngai krao khan tơgŭm, wă kơ lơ bơngai bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơdŏng đơ̆ng bơngai tơpôl krao khan.

English: For our boasting is this: the testimony of our conscience that we conducted ourselves in the world in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom but by the grace of God, and more abundantly toward you.
Bahnar: Tơdrong nhôn hiôk, nhôn hiôk yua kơ tơdrong âu: Jơhngơ̆m đon nhôn mơn kơdih nhôn pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai; mă loi pơm 'lơ̆ng pơm tơpăt hăm iĕm. Mă-lei nhôn ưh kơ bơnê kơ akâu nhôn kơdih hơgei ôh, nhôn bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm nhôn pơm 'lơ̆ng thoi noh.

English: For we are not writing any other things to you than what you read or understand. Now I trust you will understand, even to the end
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong nhôn chih kơ iĕm, nhôn ưh kơ đei chih pơjuang ôh; nhôn chih roi tơpăt hloi. Nhôn chih thoi yơ, iĕm đŏk iĕm hlôh thoi ei.

English: (as also you have understood us in part), that we are your boast as you also are ours, in the day of the Lord Jesus.
Bahnar: Dang ei iĕm tam mă băt nhên nhôn bơngai thoi yơ, layơ kơnh iĕm kư̆m hlôh mơ̆n. Thoi noh na mưh Kră Yang Yêsu Krist jur, iĕm hiôk yua kơ nhôn pơm 'lơ̆ng; nhôn kư̆m hiôk yua kơ iĕm lui đơ̆ng nhôn bơtho.

English: And in this confidence I intended to come to you before, that you might have a second benefit
Bahnar: Thoi noh na ki inh băt kơ iĕm lăp đon tơpă, na inh pơkă wă năm hơpong tơ dêh iĕm, inh wă năm tơ pơlei iĕm hơdrol

English: to pass by way of you to Macedonia, to come again from Macedonia to you, and be helped by you on my way to Judea.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng noh năm tơ dêh Masêđôn. Đơ̆ng dêh Masêđôn wih drong ngôi tơ pơlei iĕm dơ̆ng wă kơ klaih kơ rơnguơ̆. Đơ̆ng noh na inh wă kơ iĕm tơgŭm inh năm tơ dêh Juđê. Inh tơchĕng wă pơm thoi noh tơpă, mă đơ̆ng rŏng inh ưh kơ gơh kơ năm yua kơ iĕm đei tơdrong yoch, tơ̆ng inh năm inh hli kơ inh pơma pơjĭ đon iĕm, iĕm mơlâu sơ'ngon.

English: Therefore, when I was planning this, did I do it lightly? Or the things I plan, do I plan according to the flesh, that with me there should be Yes, Yes, and No, No?
Bahnar: Inh pơkă inh wă thoi noh tơpă, mă iĕm jô̆ kơ inh khan đon ưh kơ tơpăt ôh hă? Păng iĕm mơ̆ng dôm tơdrong inh pơkă thoi bơngai ưh kơ lui, hơ̆r kơ năm, năm. Ưh, ưh; thoi noh hă?

English: But as God is faithful, our word to you was not Yes and No.
Bahnar: Ưh ôh. 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang pơm trŏ thoi Sư pơkă, na nhôn kư̆m lei-lăi. Dôm tơdrong nhôn pơkă nhôn athei pơm hloi; ưh kơ sĭ nhôn pơkă phŏ 'blep phŏ ưh. Ưh kơ thoi noh ôh.

English: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us—by me, Silvanus, and Timothy—was not Yes and No, but in Him was Yes.
Bahnar: Yêsu Krist Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă nhôn đe Silas, Timôthê năm bơtho tơ tŏk-bŏk iĕm sơ̆, Sư pơkă wă tơgŭm bơ̆n ưh kơ sĭ phŏ 'blep phŏ ưh. Ưh ôh. Sư pơkă ling-lang 'blep ngăl.

English: For all the promises of God in Him are Yes, and in Him Amen, to the glory of God through us.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă tơgŭm, Yêsu Krist năm hloi. Thoi noh na dôm tơdrong bơ̆n krao khan bơ̆n pơma A-men, noh wă khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpăt ling-lang ăn Yêsu Krist jur tơgŭm tơpă.

English: Now He who establishes us with you in Christ and has anointed us is God
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei boih pơm kơ nhôn hăm iĕm lui kơ Yêsu Krist kơjăp. Kư̆m Sư boih ăn kơ nhôn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng wă kơ nhôn hơgei jang tơdrong Sư.

English: who also has sealed us and given us the Spirit in our hearts as a guarantee.
Bahnar: Sư ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei hơdai hăm nhôn, dang Sư chơ̆m đŏng yâu Sư tơ akâu nhôn, thoi noh na dôm tơdrong Sư pơkă, nhôn băt kơ gô đei tơpă.

English: Moreover I call God as witness against my soul, that to spare you I came no more to Corinth.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ inh pơma tơpăt kơ tơdrong inh ưh kơ đei năm hơpong tơ pơlei iĕm noh, ưh kơ sĭ yua inh ôh, yua iĕm. Inh hli kơ mưh inh năm iĕm mơlâu, yua kơ mưh inh năm pă jor kơ inh pơma pơjĭ đon iĕm.

English: Not that we have dominion over your faith, but are fellow workers for your joy; for by faith you stand.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ưh kơ sĭ nhôn wă pơgŏ pơđep tơdrong lui iĕm ôh. Kơlih kơ nhôn 'bôh iĕm lui kơjăp, na nhôn wă jang hơdai iĕm, wă kơ iĕm chơt.

English: But I determined this within myself, that I would not come again to you in sorrow.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na inh kuă kơ năm tơ iĕm ki, inh kuă hli kơ inh pơma pơjĭ đon iĕm, hli kơ iĕm sơ'ngon kơ inh thoi sơ̆.

English: For if I make you sorrowful, then who is he who makes me glad but the one who is made sorrowful by me?
Bahnar: Iĕm pơm kơ inh hiôk, mă inh pơm kơ iĕm sơ'ngon. Đơ̆ng noh bu wă pơm kơ inh hiôk dơ̆ng.

English: And I wrote this very thing to you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow over those from whom I ought to have joy, having confidence in you all that my joy is the joy of you all.
Bahnar: Kơthơ mă inh chih kơ iĕm ki, inh kư̆m chih khan thoi noh. Inh ling-lang wă sơđơ̆ng ngêh kơ iĕm, hiôk hăm iĕm na inh kuă kơ năm ki, hli kơ inh sơ'ngon yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ hiôk kơ đơ̆ng inh pơma pơjĭ đon iĕm. Yua kơ inh bơngai hiơ̆ hăm iĕm, iĕm băt boih.

English: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you, with many tears, not that you should be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have so abundantly for you.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh chih kơ iĕm kơthơ ki, inh ơh sơ'ngon dêh, inh nhơ̆m hmoi ơh ăi minh 'nu, mă-lei ưh kơ sĭ inh wă kơ iĕm sơ'ngon hai ôh. Inh wă kơ iĕm băt kơ inh 'mêm kơ iĕm tơpă.

English: But if anyone has caused grief, he has not grieved me, but all of you to some extent—not to be too severe.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng đe pơm kơ inh ưh kơ hiôk, ưh kơ sĭ kơdrô̆ inh ôh sơ'ngon, iĕm kư̆m sơ'ngon lei-lăi. Mă-lei tơdrong noh inh ưh kơ kăl kơ pơma lơ ôh.

English: This punishment which was inflicted by the majority is sufficient for such a man
Bahnar: Bơngai mă yoch noh dang bơ̆n phak sư mah boih yua kơ bơ̆n tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng akŭm hơdai bơ̆n ki.

English: so that, on the contrary, you ought rather to forgive and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one be swallowed up with too much sorrow.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei bơ̆n 'nĕ pă jô̆ yo kơ sư, iĕm athei dah pơlung sư đĕch hli kơ sư sơ'ngon rai dêh.

English: Therefore I urge you to reaffirm your love to him.
Bahnar: Inh bơtho iĕm thoi noh wă kơ sư 'brơ̆k mơnat băt kơ iĕm 'mêm kơ sư.

English: For to this end I also wrote, that I might put you to the test, whether you are obedient in all things.
Bahnar: Kơthơ inh chih kơ iĕm ki, athei iĕm bơtho khan kơ bơngai yoch noh, ưh kơ sĭ inh wă hil kơ sư ôh, inh chih wă pơlong lăng iĕm, wă kơ băt iĕm chu lăm dôm tơdrong.

English: Now whom you forgive anything, I also forgive. For if indeed I have forgiven anything, I have forgiven that one for your sakes in the presence of Christ
Bahnar: Iĕm huay kơ jô̆ yo kơ bôl pơm yoch, inh kư̆m huay kơ jô̆ yo mơ̆n; tơdrong inh huay kơ jô̆ yo kơ đe, noh yua kơ Yêsu Krist, Sư wă kơ inh jang tơgŭm iĕm tang Sư, thoi noh na inh ưh kơ đei kơ jô̆ yo kơ bu bu ôh.

English: lest Satan should take advantage of us; for we are not ignorant of his devices.
Bahnar: Na dang ei đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n 'nĕ pă jô̆ yo kơ bơngai mă yoch noh, hli kơ sư hiong lăm tơdrong yang Satan, yua kơ bơ̆n băt kơ yang Satan sư pơhlŭ hơgei dêh.

English: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christ’s gospel, and a door was opened to me by the Lord
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh chih kơ iĕm kơthơ noh ki, inh năm tơ Pơlei Trôs bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist tơ noh. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơchoh trong kơ inh năm jang tơdrong Sư tơ noh.

English: I had no rest in my spirit, because I did not find Titus my brother; but taking my leave of them, I departed for Macedonia.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh ưh kơ hiôk ôh chang lăng 'nhŏng Tĭt đơ̆ng năm ba kơthơ tơ iĕm ki ưh kơ jah brŏk tơ inh. Inh pă kĕ gô sư boih 'maih dah kơtơ̆ng tơdrong iĕm thoi yơ, na inh achăng lê̆ 'nhŏng oh bơngai lui Pơlei Trôs năm hơloh hloi tơ dêh Masêđôn.

English: Now thanks be to God who always leads us in triumph in Christ, and through us diffuses the fragrance of His knowledge in every place.
Bahnar: Bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm nhôn bơtho tơdrong Yêsu Krist ling-lang, jei Yêsu Krist boih, jơ̆p kơ teh đak gô kơtơ̆ng tơdrong Yêsu Krist.

English: For we are to God the fragrance of Christ among those who are being saved and among those who are perishing.
Bahnar: Nhôn bơtho đe dang lĕ tơmam 'bâu phu Yêsu Krist soh pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă kơ đĭ rim 'nu bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wă iŏk, hăm lu bơngai mă wă hiong răm 'bâu tôm.

English: To the one we are the aroma of death leading to death, and to the other the aroma of life leading to life. And who is sufficient for these things?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă wă hiong răm, lu sư 'bâu chhok hơ'nơ̆k lôch. Lu bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk, lu sư 'bâu phu pơm kơ lu sư arih ling-lang. Tơdrong jang noh trăp dêh bu kĕ jang?

English: For we are not, as so many, peddling the word of God; but as of sincerity, but as from God, we speak in the sight of God in Christ.
Bahnar: Nhôn ưh kơ sĭ pơm thoi lơ 'nu bơngai bơtho hơlĕnh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ gơh iŏk sa tơmam đe ôh. Nhôn bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh jang tơdrong Sư, na nhôn bơtho tơdrong Sư tơpăt ngăl ling-lang yua kơ Sư băt tôm tơdrong. Na nhôn gơnang kơ Yêsu Krist tơgŭm nhôn bơtho.

English: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? Or do we need, as some others, epistles of commendation to you or letters of commendation from you?
Bahnar: Nhôn pơma thoi noh, nhôn wă kơ iĕm băt kơ nhôn pơm 'bok bơtho iĕm hă? Ưh ôh. Nhôn ưh kơ kăl kơthơ đe chih tơbăt kơ iĕm, kơthơ iĕm chih tơbăt kơ đe khan nhôn 'bok bơtho iĕm ôh. Lu bơngai nai sư wă thoi noh tơpă, mă-lei lu nhôn ưh ôh.

English: You are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read by all men
Bahnar: Yua kơ iĕm lui đơ̆ng nhôn bơtho tơpă boih na lu iĕm kư̆m dang hla bơar kơthơ tơbăt kơ nhôn tơbăt kơ đe nhôn 'bok bơtho iĕm boih. Yua kơ iĕm dang hla bơar kơthơ, na đĭ-đăng bơngai gơh đŏk gơh lăng.

English: clearly you are an epistle of Christ, ministered by us, written not with ink but by the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on tablets of flesh, that is, of the heart.
Bahnar: Iĕm dang kơthơ Yêsu Krist mă nhôn chih. Mă-lei ưh kơ sĭ chih păng đak mơ̆k ôh. Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang Sư chih tơgŭm nhôn mă ưh kơ sĭ chih tơ tơmo lat thoi tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă hơdrol sơ̆ ôh, Sư chih tơ'băk tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm.

English: And we have such trust through Christ toward God.
Bahnar: Nhôn pơma kơ iĕm thoi noh, nhôn pơma kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m đon nhôn lui kơjăp thoi noh tơpă, kiơ̆ kơ nhôn gơnang kơ Yêsu Krist hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi noh.

English: Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think of anything as being from ourselves, but our sufficiency is from God
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong noh ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng akâu nhôn gơh pơm ôh, yua kơ akâu nhôn kơdih ưh kơ gơh pơm minh tơdrong kiơ. Tôm tơdrong lu nhôn gơh pơm noh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn ngăl.

English: who also made us sufficient as ministers of the new covenant, not of the letter but of the Spirit; for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ nhôn pran kơtang gơh jang tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao, tơdrong Yêsu Krist pơgơ̆p bơ̆n hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Tơdrong noh ưh kơ đei chih tơ tơmo lat thoi tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă hơdrol sơ̆ ôh, tơdrong noh Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm. Tơdrong chih tơ tơmo lat phak pơlôch kon bơngai. Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ưh ôh. Sư ling-lang ăn kon bơngai arih.

English: But if the ministry of death, written and engraved on stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not look steadily at the face of Moses because of the glory of his countenance, which glory was passing away
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơkă noh sơ̆ chih tơ tơmo lat wă phak pơlôch lu bơngai ưh kơ chu. Na lăp Môis iŏk tơmo lat noh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, muh măt Môis rang hơdah dêh, truh tơ lu bơngai Isơrael mah pă kĕ lăng muh măt sư, mă-lei muh măt Môis rai đunh ưh pă rang hơdah boih.

English: how will the ministry of the Spirit not be more glorious?
Bahnar: Na bĭ tơdrong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm bơ̆n dang ei ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng rŏ tih krưp hloh kơ noh ôh hă?

English: For if the ministry of condemnation had glory, the ministry of righteousness exceeds much more in glory.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng tơdrong pơkă noh sơ̆ 'lơ̆ng rŏ mă khan jô̆ kơ kon bơngai yoch, lei tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao mă jô̆ kơ kon bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt dang ei 'lơ̆ng rŏ hloh loi kơ tơdrong pơkă so noh.

English: For even what was made glorious had no glory in this respect, because of the glory that excels.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơgơ̆p so noh ưh pă rŏ hơnơ̆ng boih, yua kơ đei tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao 'lơ̆ng rŏ hloh loi tơpă.

English: For if what is passing away was glorious, what remains is much more glorious.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơgơ̆p so kư̆m 'lơ̆ng, kư̆m rŏ; mă sư 'bônh kơ hiong, 'bônh kơ tôch. Tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao sư oei hơnơ̆ng ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch, sư rŏ hloh loi kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p so.

English: Therefore, since we have such hope, we use great boldness of speech
Bahnar: Yua kơ nhôn băt kơ thoi noh, na jơhngơ̆m nhôn sơĭng bơtho nuih tơpă.

English: unlike Moses, who put a veil over his face so that the children of Israel could not look steadily at the end of what was passing away.
Bahnar: Môis iŏk khăn kơlŭk lum kuă ăn lu bơngai Isơrael 'bôh muh măt sư rai đunh ưh pă rang hơdah. Nhôn dang ei ưh kơ pơm thoi noh ôh. Nhôn bơtho tơbăt tôm hloi.

English: But their minds were blinded. For until this day the same veil remains unlifted in the reading of the Old Testament, because the veil is taken away in Christ.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Isơrael arăng kơ̆l đơ̆ng sơ̆ oei khơ̆ dang ei. Mưh lu sư đŏk lăng hla bơar tơdrong pơgơ̆p so, jơhngơ̆m đon lu sư dang lĕ kơ kơlŭk lum khăn yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ hlôh. Pôm lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ Kră Yang Yêsu đĕch gơh pơih lê̆ khăn noh wă khan lu sư hlôh.

English: But even to this day, when Moses is read, a veil lies on their heart.
Bahnar: Tơpă, mă đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei rim kơ lu sư wă đŏk lăng dôm tơdrong Môis chih sơ̆, jơhngơ̆m đon lu sư dang lĕ kơ kơlŭk lum khăn.

English: Nevertheless when one turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist, jơhngơ̆m đon lu sư ưh pă thoi kơlŭk lum khăn boih.

English: Now the Lord is the Spirit; and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Yêsu kư̆m thoi Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng. Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei tơ yơ, tơ anih noh rơngei hiôk-hian.

English: But we all, with unveiled face, beholding as in a mirror the glory of the Lord, are being transformed into the same image from glory to glory, just as by the Spirit of the Lord.
Bahnar: Đĭ rim lu bơ̆n bơngai lui pơih lê̆ boih khăn noh, na lu bơ̆n gơh 'bôh muh măt Kră Yang Yêsu rang hơdah, khŏm khŏm lu bơ̆n rai đunh rai hơdah thoi Sư. Tơdrong hơdah noh Sư boih pơchrang ăn kơ lu bơ̆n. Sư kư̆m thoi Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng mă ăn kơ bơ̆n arih.

English: Therefore, since we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we do not lose heart.
Bahnar: Nhôn jang tơdrong tih rŏ âu yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat đĕch. Thoi noh na nhôn wă jang ling-lang ưh kơ lê̆ ôh.

English: But we have renounced the hidden things of shame, not walking in craftiness nor handling the word of God deceitfully, but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man’s conscience in the sight of God.
Bahnar: Nhôn jang ưh kơ đei ôn tơdrong kơnê̆ hrĕp thoi lu bơngai nai ôh. Nhôn ưh kơ hơlĕnh pơdăr thoi đe, nhôn ưh kơ ming tơplih nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma. Nhôn wă pơma kiơ, nhôn pơma hơdah hloi. Nhôn pơma tơpăt wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai băt kơ nhôn bơngai tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang.

English: But even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng nhôn bơtho ưh kơ mơ̆t tơ jơhngơ̆m đon đe, noh jơhngơ̆m đon lu bơngai mă oei kơlŭk lum khăn, lu bơngai mă wă hiong răm.

English: whose minds the god of this age has blinded, who do not believe, lest the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine on them.
Bahnar: Yŏng yang sơmăt pơgơ̆r tơ ala teh âu pơm kơ lu bơngai ưh kơ lui dang bơngai măt tol, wă kơ lu sư ưh kơ 'bôh tơdrong hơdah Yêsu Krist pơchrang kơ lu sư. Thoi noh na lu sư ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist. Yêsu Krist boih hơbŏ thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: For we do not preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord, and ourselves your bondservants for Jesus’ sake.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ nhôn bơtho pơang akâu nhôn kơdih ôh. Nhôn bơtho pơang kơ đe Yêsu Krist Kră Yang bơ̆n; gah nhôn bơngai đĭch đam iĕm yua kơ tơdrong jang Yêsu Krist.

English: For it is the God who commanded light to shine out of darkness, who has shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing plĕnh teh sơ̆ Sư khan kơ măng mu athei đei hơdah na đei hloi. Na Sư kư̆m pơchrang tơdrong hơdah Sư tơ jơhngơ̆m đon nhôn, tơ muh măt Yêsu Krist, wă tơbăt kơ nhôn Sư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mơsêh tơpă.

English: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellence of the power may be of God and not of us.
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang mă Sư pơjao kơ nhôn jang âu dang lĕ kơ tơmam hu, tơmam maih pơ'mêm tah lăm bô̆i teh mă 'bônh kơ pơchah. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ nhôn jang pran noh Sư wă kơ đe băt đơ̆ng Sư ăn, đơ̆ng 'Bok mă mơsêh mơyang, ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng nhôn kơdih ôh.

English: We are hard-pressed on every side, yet not crushed; we are perplexed, but not in despair
Bahnar: Đĭ dôm tơdrong đe wă kơtĭt pơglơ̆k nhôn, mă-lei nhôn pơm huay huăi kơ glơ̆k; đĭ sơleng kơ đon boih, mă-lei nhôn khŏm adrin adrăi.

English: persecuted, but not forsaken; struck down, but not destroyed
Bahnar: Đe pơm kơnê̆ pơmat nhôn, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ lê̆ nhôn; đe teh tơpơ̆k nhôn, nhôn kư̆m huay kơ răm.

English: always carrying about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our body.
Bahnar: Akâu nhôn chu iŏk tơdrong pơmat-tat, dang lôch thoi Yêsu sơ̆, noh dang akâu nhôn tơbăt kơ đe Yêsu oei arih.

English: For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus’ sake, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our mortal flesh.
Bahnar: Nhôn arih tơ ala teh âu, đe nŏng kơ wă pơlôch yua kơ nhôn jang tơdrong Yêsu, noh dang akâu nhôn tơbăt kơ đe Yêsu oei arih, mă khan nhôn kon bơngai lôch.

English: So then death is working in us, but life in you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih tơdrong lôch, 'Bok Kei-Dei pơchĕp ăn kơ nhôn, tơdrong arih 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm.

English: And since we have the same spirit of faith, according to what is written, “I believed and therefore I spoke,” we also believe and therefore speak
Bahnar: Nhôn kư̆m đei đon lui thoi 'bok mă chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ sư khan thoi âu: “Yua kơ inh lui boih, thoi noh na inh pơma.” Na nhôn kư̆m lei-lăi, yua kơ nhôn lui na nhôn pơma bơtho đe.

English: knowing that He who raised up the Lord Jesus will also raise us up with Jesus, and will present us with you.
Bahnar: Nhôn băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Yêsu Krist, Sư gô tơiung arih nhôn mơ̆n thoi Sư tơiung arih Yêsu Krist. Klaih kơ noh Sư gô anhăk nhôn hăm iĕm oei hơdai Sư.

English: For all things are for your sakes, that grace, having spread through the many, may cause thanksgiving to abound to the glory of God.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong nhôn adrin jang wă pơyua iĕm păng wă kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat kơ kon bơngai rai jơ̆p teh, wă kơ kon bơngai bơnê hăm pơang anăn Sư rai lơ.

English: Therefore we do not lose heart. Even though our outward man is perishing, yet the inward man is being renewed day by day.
Bahnar: Thoi noh nhôn wă jang ling-lang ưh kơ lê̆ ôh, mă khan sĕch akar nhôn rai hŏnh, mă-lei jơhngơ̆m nhôn lăm to dang lĕ kơ ming 'nao rim năr.

English: For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, is working for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory
Bahnar: Nhôn iŏk tơdrong pơmat-tat dang ei kư̆m bưh, sư hơiơch 'biơ̆, nhôn hăt kơ chă tơdrong arih ling-lang ning-mônh ei kăl hloh.

English: while we do not look at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen. For the things which are seen are temporary, but the things which are not seen are eternal.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ mă bơ̆n gơh 'bôh, nhôn ưh kơ tơchĕng ôh; nhôn tơchĕng kơ tơdrong mă bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh 'bôh, yua kơ dôm tơdrong măt bơ̆n gơh 'bôh sư hiong tôch, ưh kơ gơh oei ling-lang ôh. Pôm tơdrong măt bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh 'bôh đĕch, gơh oei ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch.

English: For we know that if our earthly house, this tent, is destroyed, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.
Bahnar: Akâu bơ̆n tơ ala teh âu thoi lĕ kơ hnam oei. Tơ̆ng bơ̆n băt kơ hnam bơ̆n oei noh răm boih, bơ̆n gô đei hnam 'nao tơ plĕnh ti kơjăp hloh, ưh kơ layơ răm dơ̆ng. Hnam noh đơ̆ng tơ'ngla 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ bơ̆n, ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng ti kon bơngai pơm ôh.

English: For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed with our habitation which is from heaven
Bahnar: Nhôn oei đei akâu so, hmăng kơ dah plôh lê̆, 'maih jah đei akâu 'nao tơ plĕnh ti. Akâu 'nao thoi lĕ kơ bơ̆n hrŭk tơplih hơbĕn ao 'nao.

English: if indeed, having been clothed, we shall not be found naked.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na nhôn 'maih jah hrŭk iŏk akâu 'nao ei. Ưh kơ sĭ nhôn kuă kơ đei akâu ôh.

English: For we who are in this tent groan, being burdened, not because we want to be unclothed, but further clothed, that mortality may be swallowed up by life.
Bahnar: Nhôn hăt kơ jah đei akâu 'nao, yua kơ akâu so ưh kơ hiôk ôh pơmat-tat ling-lang; mă nhôn kư̆m ưh kơ sĭ kuă kơ akâu bơ̆n ôh, mă nhôn wă kơ jah đei akâu 'nao hrŭk pơđom hloi. 'Noh na nhôn đei akâu 'nao ling-lang hloi.

English: Now He who has prepared us for this very thing is God, who also has given us the Spirit as a guarantee.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n, Sư kư̆m ăn kơ bơ̆n Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, wă kơ bơ̆n băt bơ̆n gô đei akâu 'nao tơpă.

English: So we are always confident, knowing that while we are at home in the body we are absent from the Lord.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na mă nhôn oei hrŭk akâu so, tam mă oei hơdai Kră Yang Yêsu Krist tơ plĕnh ti, jơhngơ̆m nhôn oei hiôk ling-lang.

English: For we walk by faith, not by sight.
Bahnar: Nhôn kiơ̆ Sư kơplah oei tơ ala teh âu, nhôn kiơ̆ hăm tơdrong lui đĕch, wă kơ juăt hăm Sư, ưh kơ sĭ nhôn kiơ̆ yua kơ măt nhôn 'bôh Sư boih ôh.

English: We are confident, yes, well pleased rather to be absent from the body and to be present with the Lord.
Bahnar: Dang ei jơhngơ̆m nhôn oei hiôk ling-lang chang dah oei hơdai Kră Yang Yêsu Krist hiôk-hian ling-lang.

English: Therefore we make it our aim, whether present or absent, to be well pleasing to Him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na, mă nhôn oei đei akâu so truh kơ Sư jur, dah lôch hơdrol, kư̆m bưh mơ̆n, nhôn kư̆ kơ adrin pơm trŏ đĕch wă kơ Sư lăp đon

English: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, that each one may receive the things done in the body, according to what he has done, whether good or bad.
Bahnar: yua kơ đĭ-đăng bơ̆n ning-mônh gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu Krist sek tơlang kiơ̆ kơ akâu bơ̆n pơm 'lơ̆ng dah pơm kơnê̆, Sư apah kiơ̆ thoi noh.

English: Knowing, therefore, the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are well known to God, and I also trust are well known in your consciences.
Bahnar: Nhôn băt hli kơ Kră Yang na nhôn bơtho khan kơ đe athei lui kơ Sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei băt kơ nhôn bơngai thoi yơ, inh tơchĕng iĕm kư̆m băt kơ nhôn bơngai thoi ei mơ̆n.

English: For we do not commend ourselves again to you, but give you opportunity to boast on our behalf, that you may have an answer for those who boast in appearance and not in heart.
Bahnar: Nhôn pơma thoi noh ưh kơ sĭ nhôn wă pơang kơ iĕm ôh, nhôn pơma wă kơ iĕm hiôk 'bôh nhôn pơm trŏ. Thoi noh na mưh đe jô̆ kơ nhôn khan bơngai pơang, iĕm gơh tơl tơwih kơ lu sư, lu sư wih trŏ kơ bơngai pơang dơ̆ng, yua kơ dôm tơdrong lu sư pơma pơang 'bơ̆t anăp đe ngăl, ưh kơ đei tơpăt ôh.

English: For if we are beside ourselves, it is for God; or if we are of sound mind, it is for you.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng đe khan nhôn bơngai wơnh kư̆m bưh, noh yua kơ nhôn jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei; tơ̆ng đe khan nhôn bơngai 'lơ̆ng, 'nă hal loi, yua kơ đe pơư nhôn jang tơgŭm iĕm.

English: For the love of Christ compels us, because we judge thus: that if One died for all, then all died
Bahnar: Nhôn băt kơ Yêsu Krist 'mêm kơ bơ̆n tơpă, na nhôn ưh kơ lăng tơdrong kon bơngai ôh. Nhôn băt kơ pôm Sư đĕch lôch tang đĭ-đăng kon bơngai tơpă, thoi noh na đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n kư̆m dang lôch thoi Sư.

English: and He died for all, that those who live should live no longer for themselves, but for Him who died for them and rose again.
Bahnar: Sư lôch tang bơ̆n iung arih dơ̆ng, wă kơ bơ̆n arih huay kơ pơyua akâu bơ̆n kơdih, Sư wă kơ bơ̆n arih yua kơ tơdrong jang Sư.

English: Therefore, from now on, we regard no one according to the flesh. Even though we have known Christ according to the flesh, yet now we know Him thus no longer.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dang ei nhôn ưh pă lăng đe thoi kon bơngai ala teh juăt kơ lăng dih băl boih. Sơ̆ nhôn lăng Yêsu Krist thoi lĕ kơ kon bơngai đĕch, mă dang ei nhôn ưh pă lăng Sư thoi kon bơngai boih.

English: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; old things have passed away; behold, all things have become new.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na bu kiơ̆ Yêsu Krist, bơngai noh bơ̆n băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing sư jing bơngai 'nao, dôm tơdrong so ưh pă đei boih, sư đei tơdrong 'nao ngăl, yua kơ sư jing bơngai 'nao boih.

English: Now all things are of God, who has reconciled us to Himself through Jesus Christ, and has given us the ministry of reconciliation
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ bơ̆n, Sư athei Yêsu Krist pơgơ̆p bơ̆n jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư dơ̆ng. Na dang ei Sư wă kơ nhôn krao tơwih iĕm đe jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư.

English: that is, that God was in Christ reconciling the world to Himself, not imputing their trespasses to them, and has committed to us the word of reconciliation.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei athei Yêsu Krist pơgơ̆p kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak, wă kơ kon bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư dơ̆ng. Sư ưh pă jô̆ yo boih dôm tơdrong yoch. Thoi noh na dang ei Sư wă kơ nhôn bơtho khan krao tơwih kon bơngai jing 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư dơ̆ng.

English: Now then, we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God were pleading through us: we implore you on Christ’s behalf, be reconciled to God.
Bahnar: Dang ei nhôn jang tang Yêsu Krist năm chă bơtho đe. 'Bok Kei-Dei yua nhôn wă pơlung kon bơngai wih tơ Sư. Nhôn jang tang Yêsu Krist khan kơ đe thoi âu: “Bĕ wih tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: For He made Him who knew no sin to be sin for us, that we might become the righteousness of God in Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu Krist ưh kơ đei tơdrong yoch kiơ, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei athei Sư pŭ tơdrong yoch bơ̆n. Thoi noh na bơ̆n athei gơnang kơ Yêsu, na 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ kơ bơ̆n bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư.

English: We then, as workers together with Him also plead with you not to receive the grace of God in vain.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na nhôn bơngai jang tơgŭm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, nhôn wă khan kơ iĕm thoi âu: Iĕm sơng iŏk Yêsu Krist boih, iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơ'mêm tŭk Sư kư̆ kă

English: For He says: “In an acceptable time I have heard you, And in the day of salvation I have helped you.” Behold, now is the accepted time; behold, now is the day of salvation.
Bahnar: yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan boih tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Sư khan sơ̆ thoi âu: “Truh năr Inh wă pơklaih kon bơngai, Inh mơ̆ng 'bơ̆r ih păng tơdŏng ih.” Na jơhnơr lu bơ̆n âu boih trŏ kơ khei năr 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih kon bơngai noh.

English: We give no offense in anything, that our ministry may not be blamed.
Bahnar: Nhôn ưh kơ đei pơm kơnê̆ kơ đe minh tơdrong kiơ, wă kơ đe huay kơ pơjăm tơdrong jang nhôn.

English: But in all things we commend ourselves as ministers of God: in much patience, in tribulations, in needs, in distresses
Bahnar: Mă nhôn đei tơdrong đe pơm kơnê̆ pơmat-tat kơ nhôn, nhôn kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ kơ đe, yua kơ nhôn đĭch đam 'Bok Kei-Dei jang kiơ̆ thoi Sư wă, wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai lăng tơdrong jang nhôn 'lơ̆ng.

English: in stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labors, in sleeplessness, in fastings
Bahnar: Mă đe tôn tơbeh teh tơlơ̆, mă đe phak, mă đe pơ'brơh pơmat, dah năr nhôn jang lap, dah ưh kơ sŭk tep, dah năr nhôn kơtĕch kơ tơmam sa

English: by purity, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Spirit, by sincere love
Bahnar: nhôn pơm 'lơ̆ng ling-lang, wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai băt kơ nhôn bơngai jang 'lơ̆ng jang tơpăt. Nhôn hlôh hlăi tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi yơ, nhôn pơm kiơ̆ thoi ei; mă đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ nhôn, nhôn ưh kơ pơm tơwih ôh; nhôn dui jơhngơ̆m tai, wă kơ dim ling-lang. Nhôn gơnang kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm nhôn pơm 'lơ̆ng. Nhôn bơngai 'mêm kơ bôl buăl tơpă ưh kơ sĭ chă pơpơm đĕch ôh

English: by the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left
Bahnar: nhôn wă pơma tơpăt ling-lang, gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lăm tôm tơdrong. Tơdrong nhôn pơm tơpăt thoi lĕ kơ đe chĕp khêl gah 'ma gah 'ngiĕo wă tơblah, mă nhôn wă blah tŭk dôm tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: by honor and dishonor, by evil report and good report; as deceivers, and yet true
Bahnar: Mă đe pơư bơnê, mă đe pơchê pơjăm, mă đe bâu roi, nhôn kư̆ kơ pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ đe; đe khan nhôn bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr, nhôn kư̆ kơ pơm tơpăt.

English: as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and behold we live; as chastened, and yet not killed
Bahnar: Đe lăng nhôn thoi bơngai đe ưh kơ ang, mă-lei kư̆m đei bơngai băt kơ nhôn mơ̆n; đe lăng nhôn thoi lĕ kơ bơngai lôch boih, mă-lei nhôn oei arih arăi; đe tôn teh nhôn dêh, mă-lei nhôn huay kơ lôch.

English: as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.
Bahnar: Đe lăng nhôn đei tơdrong sơ'ngon, mă-lei nhôn hiôk chơt ling-lang; đe lăng nhôn bơngai dơnuh, mă-lei đei lơ bơngai mơdrŏng yua kơ nhôn; đe lăng nhôn hoh-hoy kơbĭ đei kiơ, mă-lei nhôn đei tôm tơdrong tơmam.

English: O Corinthians! We have spoken openly to you, our heart is wide open.
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai Pơlei Kôrintô, nhôn pơma kơ iĕm rơhau dêh, yua kơ nhôn 'mêm kơ iĕm tơpă.

English: You are not restricted by us, but you are restricted by your own affections.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ nhôn kuă kơ pơm buăl hăm iĕm ôh, hli kơ iĕm đĕch kuă kơ pơm buăl hăm nhôn.

English: Now in return for the same (I speak as to children), you also be open.
Bahnar: Inh pơma kơ iĕm dang 'bă pơma kơ kon, inh 'mêm kơ iĕm tơpă, inh kư̆m wă kơ iĕm 'mêm kơ inh.

English: Do not be unequally yoked together with unbelievers. For what fellowship has righteousness with lawlessness? And what communion has light with darkness?
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ tôi 'long ăt hơdai hăm lu bơngai ưh kơ lui, yua kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng hăm tơdrong kơnê̆ ưh kơ gơh pơgơ̆p băl ôh; tơdrong hơdah hăm măng mu kư̆m lei-lăi ưh kơ gơh tơ jê̆ băl.

English: And what accord has Christ with Belial? Or what part has a believer with an unbeliever?
Bahnar: Kră Yang Yêsu Krist hăm yang sơmăt ưh kơ layơ chu băl; bơngai lui hăm bơngai ưh kơ lui ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ gơh pơgơ̆p băl hơdai.

English: And what agreement has the temple of God with idols? For you are the temple of the living God. As God has said: “I will dwell in them And walk among them. I will be their God, And they shall be My people.”
Bahnar: Hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm rup yang nai ưh kơ gơh tơmơ̆t băl ôh. Lu bơ̆n kư̆m dang hnam oei 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang, yua kơ Sư khan boih thoi âu: “Inh wă oei hơdai iĕm, nơnăm hơdai iĕm; Inh pơm Kră Yang iĕm, iĕm jing kon pơlei pơla Inh.”

English: Therefore “Come out from among them And be separate, says the Lord. Do not touch what is unclean, And I will receive you.”
Bahnar: “Thoi noh yua kơ Inh Kră Yang iĕm na Inh athei iĕm lĕch jăk đơ̆ng lu bơngai ưh kơ lui. Tơklah đơ̆ng lu sư, 'nĕ pă pel 'bơm dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lu sư, na Inh gô sơng iŏk iĕm.

English: “I will be a Father to you, And you shall be My sons and daughters, Says the LORD Almighty.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Inh trŏ kơ pơm 'Bă iĕm, iĕm jing kon tơdăm kon adruh Inh. 'Noh tơdrong Kră Yang tơm rơh tih hloh khan kơ bơ̆n.”

English: Therefore, having these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
Bahnar: Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh mă inh 'mêm kơeng, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ bơ̆n jing kon Sư thoi noh boih, na bơ̆n athei tŭk lê̆ đĭ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach đơ̆ng akâu bơ̆n juăt kơ pơm, hăm đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m đon bơ̆n tơchĕng kơnê̆; bơ̆n athei adrin pơm mă tơpăt lăm tôm tơdrong, yua kơ bơ̆n băt hli kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Open your hearts to us. We have wronged no one, we have corrupted no one, we have cheated no one.
Bahnar: Nhôn kư̆m wă kơ iĕm 'mêm kơ nhôn, yua kơ nhôn ưh kơ đei pơm kơnê̆ kơ bu ôh, ưh kơ đei pơrăm pơyoch bu ôh, ưh kơ đei hơlĕnh pơdăr sa tơmam bu ôh.

English: I do not say this to condemn; for I have said before that you are in our hearts, to die together and to live together.
Bahnar: Inh pơma thoi noh ưh kơ sĭ inh hil lach kơ iĕm ôh, inh 'mêm kơ iĕm tơpă. Kư̆m thoi inh chih khan kơ iĕm hơdrol boih, iĕm minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon hăm inh, mă lôch mă arih bơ̆n hơdai.

English: Great is my boldness of speech toward you, great is my boasting on your behalf. I am filled with comfort. I am exceedingly joyful in all our tribulation.
Bahnar: Inh lui kơ iĕm gô pơm trŏ tôm tơdrong ling-lang, inh kư̆m roi pơang tơdrong iĕm kơ đe. Jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk dêh yua kơ inh kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong iĕm boih; mă khan nhôn đei tơdrong truh pơmat-tat dang âu dang noh, nhôn ưh pă sơ'ngon tơdrong kiơ boih.

English: For indeed, when we came to Macedonia, our bodies had no rest, but we were troubled on every side. Outside were conflicts, inside were fears.
Bahnar: Âu roi gah tơdrong nhôn truh tơ dêh Masêđôn, nhôn truh tơ noh kư̆m ưh kơ đei hiôk kơ jơhngơ̆m tŏ sĕt, oei tơ noh lĕ pơmat hloh loi; jơhngơ̆m đon nhôn oei sa 'nhŏ kơ sơđơ̆ng 'biơ̆. Đon nhôn kư̆m tơchĕng hli kơ iĕm lui ưh kơ kơjăp.

English: Nevertheless God, who comforts the downcast, comforted us by the coming of Titus
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh hơmet ming jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai sơ'ngon jing hiôk, thoi noh na Sư jah ăn Tĭt truh tơ nhôn, chhơp boih.

English: and not only by his coming, but also by the consolation with which he was comforted in you, when he told us of your earnest desire, your mourning, your zeal for me, so that I rejoiced even more.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ nhôn hiôk yua kơ Tĭt truh tơ nhôn đĕch ôh. Nhôn hiôk yua kơ sư roi kơ nhôn tơdrong iĕm pơma dơnuh hăm sư hiôk hơiă chang nhôn dah truh tơ iĕm dơ̆ng. Inh kơtơ̆ng iĕm sơ'ngon yua kơ tơdrong iĕm pơm yoch, 'maih kiơ̆ tơdrong inh bơtho noh, inh hiôk rai dêh.

English: For even if I made you sorry with my letter, I do not regret it; though I did regret it. For I perceive that the same epistle made you sorry, though only for a while.
Bahnar: Kơthơ inh chih kơ iĕm hơdrol ki inh kư̆m hmach kơ chih 'biơ̆ mơ̆n, pơm kơ iĕm sơ'ngon; mă-lei inh tơchĕng dơ̆ng đơ̆ng rŏng huay kơ hmach ôh, tơdrong sơ'ngon pơm kơ iĕm minh yuh đĕch.

English: Now I rejoice, not that you were made sorry, but that your sorrow led to repentance. For you were made sorry in a godly manner, that you might suffer loss from us in nothing.
Bahnar: Mă inh hiôk ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ kơthơ noh pơm kơ iĕm sơ'ngon ôh; inh hiôk yua kơ iĕm tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm băt kơ sơ'ngon thoi noh, nhôn ưh kơ đei pơm kơ iĕm sơ'ngon minh tơdrong kiơ.

English: For godly sorrow produces repentance leading to salvation, not to be regretted; but the sorrow of the world produces death.
Bahnar: Tơdrong sơ'ngon yua kơ bơ̆n băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ bơ̆n tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch huay kơ sơ'ngon; mă-lei dah bơ̆n sơ'ngon kơ tơdrong ala teh, bơ̆n gô hiong răm đĕch ưh kơ yua kiơ kơ bơ̆n.

English: For observe this very thing, that you sorrowed in a godly manner: What diligence it produced in you, what clearing of yourselves, what indignation, what fear, what vehement desire, what zeal, what vindication! In all things you proved yourselves to be clear in this matter.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ iĕm băt kơ sơ'ngon akâu kơdih, wă kơ iĕm hưch hanh pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơdrong tơpăt; tơdrong akâu kơdih đêl pơm, wă kơ tơbral hli huay pă pơm dơ̆ng; dang ei iĕm hăt kơ pơm tơdrong tơpăt, iĕm dang phak boih bơngai yoch, iĕm kư̆m wă kơ tơ'bơ̆p nhôn dơ̆ng; tôm tơdrong iĕm sek tơlang bơngai yoch noh 'lơ̆ng boih.

English: Therefore, although I wrote to you, I did not do it for the sake of him who had done the wrong, nor for the sake of him who suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear to you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kơthơ noh ưh kơ sĭ kơ inh chih kơdrô̆ tơdrong bơngai mă yoch hăm bơngai mă pŭ tơdrong pơ'brơh noh ôh; inh kư̆m chih wă tơ'blŏk kơ iĕm tơdrong iĕm 'maih kiơ̆ nhôn tơpă mă đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei, tơdrong noh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m băt.

English: Therefore we have been comforted in your comfort. And we rejoiced exceedingly more for the joy of Titus, because his spirit has been refreshed by you all.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dang ei inh hiôk tơpă, kơtơ̆ng tôm tơdrong iĕm pơm 'lơ̆ng boih păng pơthim kơ nhôn 'bôh Tĭt sư hiôk wih đơ̆ng iĕm 'bôh pơm trŏ boih.

English: For if in anything I have boasted to him about you, I am not ashamed. But as we spoke all things to you in truth, even so our boasting to Titus was found true.
Bahnar: Ki nhi Tĭt kư̆m pơma dơnuh gah tơdrong iĕm mơ̆n, mă inh pơma pơang iĕm inh huay kơ mơlâu ôh, inh pơma 'bơ̆t anăp sư yua kơ inh băt kơ iĕm gô pơm trŏ tơpă. Na 'blep trŏ thoi noh tơpă, noh kư̆m thoi tơdrong nhôn juăt kơ pơma kơ iĕm tơpăt ling-lang.

English: And his affections are greater for you as he remembers the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling you received him.
Bahnar: Mă loi sư ưh kơ hiơt kơ tơdrong iĕm sơng iŏk sư păng chu yom kơ sư, noh na sư 'mêm kơ iĕm rai dêh.

English: Therefore I rejoice that I have confidence in you in everything.
Bahnar: Inh hiôk dêh yua kơ inh băt kơ iĕm gô pơm 'lơ̆ng pơm trŏ lăm tôm tơdrong.

English: Moreover, brethren, we make known to you the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, inh wă roi tơbăt kơ iĕm tơdrong đe 'nhŏng oh bơngai lui bơ̆n tơ dêh Masêđôn 'lơ̆ng dêh, 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ lu sư băt 'mêm băt mơnat kơ lu bôl lui.

English: that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded in the riches of their liberality.
Bahnar: Lu sư đei tơdrong gleh pơmat-tat păng dơnuh tăm mă-lei jơhngơ̆m lu sư hiôk hơiă păng hơlăng băt kơ pơtơm băl ra jên tơgŭm lu bơngai lui dơnuh hin tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: For I bear witness that according to their ability, yes, and beyond their ability, they were freely willing
Bahnar: Inh khan tơpă, lu sư ra jên ra tơmam kiơ̆ kơ lu sư đei, phŏ lu sư kư̆m ăn hloh kơ lu sư đei. Mă-lei tơdrong noh ưh kơ sĭ kơ nhôn pơgŏ ôh, lu sư lăp đon kơdih.

English: imploring us with much urgency that we would receive the gift and the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.
Bahnar: Lu sư nŏng kơ apinh nhôn lơ 'măng wă kơ nhôn ăn kơ lu sư wang tơgŭm jên tơmam kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin.

English: And not only as we had hoped, but they first gave themselves to the Lord, and then to us by the will of God.
Bahnar: Nhôn ngêh kơ lu sư pơm 'blep kơ đon nhôn tơchĕng đĕch, lu sư pơm hloh kơ đon nhôn tơchĕng dơ̆ng; lu sư pơyơ̆r ăn akâu lu sư kơ Kră Yang wă tơgŭm nhôn hai, lu sư pơm thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon dêh.

English: So we urged Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also complete this grace in you as well.
Bahnar: Na tơdrong ra jên tơmam tơ pơlei iĕm noh, nhôn jao kơ Tĭt jang khŏm khŏm yua kơ sơ̆ sư đêl jang tơdrong noh boih.

English: But as you abound in everything—in faith, in speech, in knowledge, in all diligence, and in your love for us—see that you abound in this grace also.
Bahnar: Iĕm hơgei tôm tơdrong boih, mă tơdrong lui, mă tơdrong bơtho, tơdrong hlôh wao tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, jơhngơ̆m iĕm hưch hanh băt kơ 'maih adrin jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei păng băt 'mêm kơ nhôn. Na dang ei inh tơchĕng iĕm kư̆m wă tơgŭm lu bơngai dơnuh mơ̆n rŏ lăng.

English: I speak not by commandment, but I am testing the sincerity of your love by the diligence of others.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong noh ưh kơ sĭ inh wă pơgŏ iĕm ôh, inh wă pơlong lăng iĕm hăm băt 'mêm kơ bôl buăl thoi lu bơngai lui tơ dêh Masêđôn dah ưh.

English: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though He was rich, yet for your sakes He became poor, that you through His poverty might become rich.
Bahnar: Yua kơ iĕm băt boih Kră Yang Yêsu Krist 'mêm mơnat kơ bơ̆n dang yơ; Sư mơdrŏng tih tơpă, mă-lei Sư jing dơnuh yua kơ tơgŭm bơ̆n, wă kơ bơ̆n jing mơdrŏng.

English: And in this I give advice: It is to your advantage not only to be doing what you began and were desiring to do a year ago
Bahnar: Sơnăm sơ̆ iĕm kư̆m đêl pơtơm boih tơdrong wă tơgŭm lu bơngai dơnuh hin noh, iĕm kư̆m wă tơpă; na dang ei inh wă kơ iĕm pơjing dơ̆ng tơdrong noh mă tơpă bĕ.

English: but now you also must complete the doing of it; that as there was a readiness to desire it, so there also may be a completion out of what you have.
Bahnar: Pơm kiơ̆ kơ đêl iĕm pơkă boih, mơ̆ng kơ iĕm đei.

English: For if there is first a willing mind, it is accepted according to what one has, and not according to what he does not have.
Bahnar: Mă tơ̆ng iĕm 'maih ra jên hơdai bôl ră, mă iĕm ưh kơ đei, noh huay ôh, 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m hiôk mơ̆n.

English: For I do not mean that others should be eased and you burdened
Bahnar: Tơdrong inh wă kơ iĕm tơgŭm đe, ưh kơ sĭ inh wă kơ iĕm dơnuh, đe jing mơdrŏng, ưh ôh. Inh wă kơ iĕm atŏ atŏ dih băl.

English: but by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may supply their lack, that their abundance also may supply your lack—that there may be equality.
Bahnar: Dang ei iĕm oei đei lơ tơmam rơkah rơkai, na apinh iĕm wang tơgŭm lu sư bơngai oei jơ̆l; layơ iĕm jơ̆l, lu sư đei, lu sư tơgŭm iĕm dơ̆ng. Thoi noh na iĕm hăm lu sư jing atŏ atŏ dih băl.

English: As it is written, “He who gathered much had nothing left over, and he who gathered little had no lack.”
Bahnar: 'Noh kư̆m thoi lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sơ̆: “Bu dônh 'bĕng mana lơ kư̆m ưh kơ rơkah, bu dônh tŏ sĕt kư̆m mah kơ sa mơ̆n.”

English: But thanks be to God who puts the same earnest care for you into the heart of Titus.
Bahnar: Inh bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ Tĭt hưch hanh kơ năm tơgŭm iĕm kư̆m thoi inh hưch hanh kơ tơgŭm iĕm ling-lang.

English: For he not only accepted the exhortation, but being more diligent, he went to you of his own accord.
Bahnar: Sư chu kơ nơ̆r inh wơh, mă sư kư̆m lăp đon wă tơgŭm iĕm, na sư wă năm tơ iĕm boih.

English: And we have sent with him the brother whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches
Bahnar: Nhôn kư̆m wơh 'bar 'nu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n bơngai lui kiơ̆ Tĭt, minh 'nu đĭ-đăng bơngai lui rim hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei ư-ang sư bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pran dêh.

English: and not only that, but who was also chosen by the churches to travel with us with this gift, which is administered by us to the glory of the Lord Himself and to show your ready mind
Bahnar: Mă ưh kơ sĭ kơ tơdrong noh đĕch, sư âu đơ̆ng rim hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih wă kiơ̆ nhôn chĕp ba jên đơ̆ng iĕm đơ̆ng đe ra. Tơdrong ra jên noh wă pơư pơang anăn Kră Yang păng wă kơ đe băt kơ bơ̆n bơngai lăp đon kơ tơgŭm đe tơpă.

English: avoiding this: that anyone should blame us in this lavish gift which is administered by us
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ lu bơngai noh tơgŭm gah tơdrong ra jên yua kơ inh hli kơ đe jô̆ kơ inh pơm ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, pơm ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơdrong iŏk jên iĕm wă tơgŭm đe noh.

English: providing honorable things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.
Bahnar: Nhôn adrin pơm tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm kon bơngai.

English: And we have sent with them our brother whom we have often proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, because of the great confidence which we have in you.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu 'nhŏng oh âu dơ̆ng inh kư̆m wơh sư kiơ̆ Tĭt, inh pơlong lăng sư lơ tơdrong boih, na inh băt kơ sư adrin adran jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă. Na dang ei sư băt kơ iĕm wă adrin pơjing tơdrong noh, sư rai 'maih adrin loi.

English: If anyone inquires about Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker concerning you. Or if our brethren are inquired about, they are messengers of the churches, the glory of Christ.
Bahnar: Âu roi gah Tĭt iĕm băt boih, sư 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n jang hơdai hăm inh đơ̆ng sơ̆ boih; na dang ei sư wă tơgŭm wei-lăng iĕm dơ̆ng. Gah 'bar 'nu 'nhŏng oh mă kiơ̆ sư, noh đơ̆ng lu bơngai lui rim hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih bre sư jang tang lu sư, bre sư bơngai pơư pơang anăn Kră Yang Yêsu Krist.

English: Therefore show to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love and of our boasting on your behalf.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm athei ra mă tơpă na lu sư băt kơ iĕm 'mêm mơnat kơ bôl buăl bơngai lui tơpă; păng sư gô băt kơ nhôn ư-ang iĕm 'blep tơpă, đĭ-đăng bơngai lui jơ̆p kơ teh đak kư̆m wang băt.

English: Now concerning the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong ra jên wă tơgŭm lu bơngai lui dơnuh, inh ưh kơ kăl kơ chih roi dơ̆ng boih

English: for I know your willingness, about which I boast of you to the Macedonians, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal has stirred up the majority.
Bahnar: yua kơ inh băt kơ iĕm 'maih tơgŭm bôl tơpă. 'Noh na inh roi pơang tơdrong lu iĕm mă oei tơ dêh Grĕk kơ lu bơngai lui tơ dêh Masêđôn, tơdrong iĕm 'maih tơgŭm lu đe noh đơ̆ng sơnăm sơ̆ boih. Lu sư 'bôh iĕm chơgăm, lu sư kư̆m 'maih mơ̆n.

English: Yet I have sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this respect, that, as I said, you may be ready
Bahnar: Tơdrong inh wơh lu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n năm tơgŭm iĕm âu, inh hli kơ iĕm jor kơ ra jên tơmam yua kơ đêl inh chă roi tơbăt kơ đe boih, thoi noh na inh wơh lu sư rai pơjing tơdrong âu đei hơdrol, thoi inh roi boih kơ lu bơngai oei tơ dêh Masêđôn.

English: lest if some Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, we (not to mention you!) should be ashamed of this confident boasting.
Bahnar: Hli kơ đei lu bơngai đơ̆ng dêh Masêđôn kiơ̆ inh năm tơ iĕm, na 'bôh iĕm tơra ưh tam mă tôm, inh mơlâu, yua kơ đêl inh roi tơbăt kơ lu sư boih; mă iĕm kư̆m mơlâu kơ lu sư hloh loi kơ inh mơ̆n.

English: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren to go to you ahead of time, and prepare your generous gift beforehand, which you had previously promised, that it may be ready as a matter of generosity and not as a grudging obligation.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na inh wơh lu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n âu năm hơdrol, wă kơ lu sư tơgŭm iĕm rai hơmet ra lê̆ dôm tơdrong noh hơdrol. Ưh kơ sĭ nhôn pơgŏ iĕm ôh, kiơ̆ kơ iĕm đêl pơkă đơ̆ng sơnăm sơ̆ boih. 'Noh na lăp nhôn truh tơ iĕm, iĕm đei tôm boih.

English: But this I say: He who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and he who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ hiơt kơ tơdrong âu: Bơngai bu rei tŏ sĕt gô kĕch tŏ sĕt; bơngai bu rei lơ, sư gô kĕch lơ.

English: So let each one give as he purposes in his heart, not grudgingly or of necessity; for God loves a cheerful giver.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu athei ăn kiơ̆ kơ đon sư 'maih kơdih, ăn athei ăn kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m mă hiôk, 'nĕ kơ ăn thoi đe pơgŏ, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ lu bơngai mă ăn hiôk kơ jơhngơ̆m.

English: And God is able to make all grace abound toward you, that you, always having all sufficiency in all things, may have an abundance for every good work.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ iĕm tơmam rơkah rơkai, wă kơ iĕm đei tôm tơmam ling-lang păng wă kơ iĕm chă tơgŭm đe nai dơ̆ng.

English: As it is written: “He has dispersed abroad, He has given to the poor; His righteousness endures forever.”
Bahnar: 'Noh kư̆m thoi đe chih roi tơdrong bơngai lui kơjăp lăm hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu: “Sư asong tơmam sư kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin, sư pơm 'lơ̆ng tơgŭm đe ling-lang.”

English: Now may He who supplies seed to the sower, and bread for food, supply and multiply the seed you have sown and increase the fruits of your righteousness
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơngai rei, găr adrĕch păng tơmam sa, sư kư̆m ăn tôm kơ găr adrĕch mă iĕm rei đei plei trem yua kơ iĕm bơngai 'lơ̆ng băt kơ tơgŭm đe.

English: while you are enriched in everything for all liberality, which causes thanksgiving through us to God.
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ iĕm gô jing mơdrŏng đei tôm tơdrong tơmam, wă kơ iĕm gơh tơgŭm đe ling-lang, thoi noh na nhôn gô roi kơ đe tơdrong iĕm hơlăng, na đe gô bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: For the administration of this service not only supplies the needs of the saints, but also is abounding through many thanksgivings to God
Bahnar: Iĕm hơlăng kơ đe jên tơmam, ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ sư jơ̆l đĕch ôh, iĕm kư̆m dang tơgŭm sư bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: while, through the proof of this ministry, they glorify God for the obedience of your confession to the gospel of Christ, and for your liberal sharing with them and all men
Bahnar: Lu sư gô 'bôh tơdrong iĕm tơgŭm lu sư, na lu sư gô bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm lui kơ Yêsu Krist kơjăp băt chu kơ Sư. Lu sư gô ư-ang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơdrong iĕm hơlăng kơ lu sư hăm đe nai tơmam.

English: and by their prayer for you, who long for you because of the exceeding grace of God in you.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm iĕm păng lu sư 'mêm kơ iĕm tơpă, yua kơ lu sư 'bôh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm.

English: Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift!
Bahnar: Bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong hiôk ưh kơ băt dang yơ wơh Kon Sư kơdih lôch tang bơ̆n.

English: Now I, Paul, myself am pleading with you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ—who in presence am lowly among you, but being absent am bold toward you.
Bahnar: Inh Pôl wă pơma păng iĕm tơdrong âu. Lơliơ lu bơngai mơ'nah jô̆ kơ inh khan kơplah inh oei ataih đơ̆ng iĕm, inh chih kơthơ, inh pơma nuih; mưh inh oei jê̆ iĕm khan inh pơma lêl? Yêsu Krist Sư dim gơh găt dêh, na Sư wă kơ bơ̆n kư̆m thoi noh.

English: But I beg you that when I am present I may not be bold with that confidence by which I intend to be bold against some, who think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
Bahnar: Inh khan lê̆ kơ iĕm hơdrol, mưh inh truh tơ iĕm kơnh pơgê, iĕm chu kơ inh, na inh huay kơ pơma kơtang kơ iĕm. Lu bơngai mă jô̆ kơ inh khan inh thoi lĕ bơngai ưh kơ lui oei tơ ala teh âu, noh lê̆ kơ nhôn pơma dih băl lu sư khan inh bơngai lêl.

English: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war according to the flesh.
Bahnar: Mă khan nhôn oei tơ ala teh âu ưh kơ sĭ nhôn tơblah thoi lu bơngai tơ ala teh âu ôh.

English: For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal but mighty in God for pulling down strongholds
Bahnar: Khêl đao nhôn tơblah, ưh kơ thoi khêl đao lu bơngai ala teh âu ôh. Khêl đao nhôn wă khan tơdrong 'bơ̆r mơsêh mơyang 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă pơrăm lê̆ dôm tơdrong kon bơngai gơnang sơđơ̆ng

English: casting down arguments and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God, bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ
Bahnar: păng dôm tơdrong ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, ưh kơ trŏ đon kon bơngai tơchĕng, tơdrong lu sư wă pơgăn tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Nhôn athei lu sư chu yom kơ Yêsu Krist lăm tôm tơdrong.

English: and being ready to punish all disobedience when your obedience is fulfilled.
Bahnar: Păng lăp nhôn truh tơ iĕm kơnh, bu ưh tam chu kơ nhôn, nhôn wă bơtho khan phak tơbral đon sư; dôm lu iĕm mă chu, huay boih.

English: Do you look at things according to the outward appearance? If anyone is convinced in himself that he is Christ’s, let him again consider this in himself, that just as he is Christ’s, even so we are Christ’s.
Bahnar: Tơdrong âu iĕm athei tơchĕng mă nhên, bơngai bu khan Yêsu Krist 'mêm kơ sư, nhôn kư̆m khan Yêsu Krist 'mêm kơ nhôn mơ̆n. Iĕm athei băt Yêsu Krist 'mêm kơ bơ̆n lei-lăi đĕch.

English: For even if I should boast somewhat more about our authority, which the Lord gave us for edification and not for your destruction, I shall not be ashamed
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m dang pơang akâu kơdih, yua kơ tơdrong âu trŏ kơ tơdrong jang inh wă bơtho tơgŭm iĕm, mă-lei inh ưh kơ đei khan wă pơrăm iĕm ôh; păng inh ưh kơ mơlâu yua kơ trŏ tơdrong jang inh thoi noh tơpă.

English: lest I seem to terrify you by letters.
Bahnar: Dôm kơthơ inh chih, ưh kơ đei chih tơhli iĕm ôh

English: “For his letters,” they say, “are weighty and powerful, but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible.”
Bahnar: thoi lu đe mă jô̆ kơ inh, khan kơthơ inh chih pơma kơtang dêh, mă-lei mưh inh oei hơdai lu sư tơpă, lu sư jô̆ kơ inh khan bơngai lêl, bơngai pơma ưh kơ yua.

English: Let such a person consider this, that what we are in word by letters when we are absent, such we will also be in deed when we are present.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đon sư tơchĕng thoi noh, bơngai noh athei pơwao kơdih mă trŏ thoi tơdrong nhôn chih, yua kơ dôm tơdrong nhôn chih pơkă tơ rim kơthơ, mưh nhôn truh tơ iĕm, nhôn gô pơm 'blep tôm tơdrong thoi nhôn chih noh.

English: For we dare not class ourselves or compare ourselves with those who commend themselves. But they, measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh 'bơ̆r lu sư kơdih đĕch khan trŏ kơ lu sư pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist. Nhôn ưh kơ pơ̆n pơm thoi noh ôh, nhôn gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn. Lu bơngai noh lu sư ưh kơ hlôh, na lu sư tah akâu kơdih pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu.

English: We, however, will not boast beyond measure, but within the limits of the sphere which God appointed us—a sphere which especially includes you.
Bahnar: Nhôn ưh kơ đei pơang tơdrong nhôn jang hloh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ôh, nhôn jang 'blep thoi Sư pơkă đĕch, na tơdrong jang nhôn Sư pơjao kơ nhôn bơtho tơgŭm iĕm.

English: For we are not overextending ourselves (as though our authority did not extend to you), for it was to you that we came with the gospel of Christ
Bahnar: Tơdrong nhôn bơtho iĕm dang ei ưh kơ sĭ nhôn pơhloh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei chơchă kơdih ôh, tơdrong nhôn bơtho iĕm âu 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjao kơ nhôn, na nhôn năm bơtho iĕm tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist đơ̆ng sơ̆ boih, ưh tam đei bu nai bơtho adrol kơ lu nhôn.

English: not boasting of things beyond measure, that is, in other men’s labors, but having hope, that as your faith is increased, we shall be greatly enlarged by you in our sphere
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai khŭl nai lui kơjăp đơ̆ng đe bơtho, nhôn ưh kơ đei pơma khan đơ̆ng nhôn bơtho ôh. Mă iĕm âu đơ̆ng anăp nhôn bơtho tơpă, na nhôn chang iĕm jah lui kơjăp, wă kơ iĕm jah tơgŭm nhôn bơtho jơ̆p kơ tơring iĕm.

English: to preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man’s sphere of accomplishment.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na nhôn gơh năm bơtho jơ̆p kơ tơring pah to kơ iĕm, dang ei ưh tam đei bu bơtho kơ lu sư tơdrong Yêsu. Nhôn wă năm bơtho tơ noh wă kơ nhôn huay kơ pơang akâu thoi lu bơngai noh jang tơ anih đêl đe jang khan đe lui đơ̆ng sư bơtho.

English: But “he who glories, let him glory in the LORD.”
Bahnar: Lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đei khan sơ̆ thoi âu: “Bơ̆n 'nĕ pă pơang akâu kơdih, bơ̆n athei pơang anăn Kră Yang đĕch.”

English: For not he who commends himself is approved, but whom the Lord commends.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ Kră Yang lăp đon kơ bơngai mă pơang akâu kơdih ôh, Sư lăp đon kơ bơngai bu mă Sư 'bôh pơm 'lơ̆ng pơm trŏ.

English: Oh, that you would bear with me in a little folly—and indeed you do bear with me.
Bahnar: Dang ei inh kư̆m dang pơang akâu kơdih, apinh iĕm adrin mơ̆ng 'biơ̆ inh bơngai kơhlôh kơwao, inh chă pơma sa kơ iĕm, thoi iĕm mơ̆ng đơ̆ng sơ̆.

English: For I am jealous for you with godly jealousy. For I have betrothed you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
Bahnar: Inh gar 'mêm kơ iĕm kư̆m thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei gar; inh pơjao iĕm kơ Yêsu Krist, thoi bơngai kơdranh pơjao minh 'nu adruh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt kơ pơyô sư tơdăm kư̆m 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: But I fear, lest somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve by his craftiness, so your minds may be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.
Bahnar: Inh hli kơ lu bơngai mă pơjăm inh pơhlŭ iĕm jing jrok trong ưh pă 'mêm kơ Yêsu Krist, thoi yă bơ̆n Ewơ lui kơ 'bih hơlĕnh pơdăr kơ sư sơ̆.

English: For if he who comes preaches another Jesus whom we have not preached, or if you receive a different spirit which you have not received, or a different gospel which you have not accepted—you may well put up with it!
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh băt kơ iĕm bơngai 'bônh kơ put đe, inh hli kơ đe bơtho iĕm tơdrong Yêsu Krist ưh pă thoi inh bơtho, mă iĕm wă lui hloi; đe bơtho iĕm tơdrong nai, ưh kơ thoi tơdrong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng bơtho mă iĕm sơng iŏk sơ̆, mă iĕm wă mơ̆ng hloi; đe khan wă bơtho iĕm tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng mă tơdrong noh ưh pă thoi iĕm lui sơ̆, mă iĕm wă chu hloi.

English: For I consider that I am not at all inferior to the most eminent apostles.
Bahnar: Iĕm tơchĕng lu bơngai noh jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist tơpă, lu sư hơgei tơpă hă? Inh hơgei mơ̆n, inh ưh kơ thuơ kơ lu sư ôh.

English: Even though I am untrained in speech, yet I am not in knowledge. But we have been thoroughly manifested among you in all things.
Bahnar: Mă khan inh bơtho kơtul ưh kơ hơgei, mă-lei inh nhen mơn hlôh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, na inh đơ̆ng sơ̆ ling-lang bơtho iĕm thoi noh.

English: Did I commit sin in humbling myself that you might be exalted, because I preached the gospel of God to you free of charge?
Bahnar: Kơplah inh bơtho iĕm tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, inh iŏk đon ala kơ đe ưh kơ wă iŏk sa tơmam iĕm apah; inh jang sa kơdih bơtho rah iĕm wă kơ iĕm hiôk chơt. Đe ưh kơ hiôk kơ inh tơdrong noh hă na đe pơjăm inh ei?

English: I robbed other churches, taking wages from them to minister to you.
Bahnar: Inh đei sa apah mơ̆n, đơ̆ng lu bơngai lui pơlei nai. Inh iŏk đĕch tơmam lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng ră, mă-lei wă kơ inh gơh jang tơgŭm iĕm.

English: And when I was present with you, and in need, I was a burden to no one, for what I lacked the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied. And in everything I kept myself from being burdensome to you, and so I will keep myself.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh oei păng iĕm noh, inh kư̆m jơ̆l ră mơ̆n mă-lei inh ưh kơ pơgŏ athei iĕm 'me inh ôh. Inh đei lu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n đơ̆ng dêh Masêđôn chă tơgŭm mơnat kơ inh bơ̆n kon jên bơ̆n tơmam sa. Bĭ mă layơ inh ưh kơ wă athei iĕm tơgŭm inh ôh.

English: As the truth of Christ is in me, no one shall stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
Bahnar: Inh băt kơ Yêsu Krist oei lăm inh, Sư wă kơ inh pơma tơpăt, na inh wă roi tơbăt kơ đe dôm tơdrong inh kuă kơ pơgŏ sa tơmam đơ̆ng iĕm, jơ̆p kơ dêh Grĕk gô băt mơ̆n.

English: Why? Because I do not love you? God knows!
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ inh pơma thoi noh, yua kơ inh ưh kơ 'mêm kơ iĕm hă? Ưh ôh. Tơdrong noh 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư băt kơ inh 'mêm kơ iĕm tơpă.

English: But what I do, I will also continue to do, that I may cut off the opportunity from those who desire an opportunity to be regarded just as we are in the things of which they boast.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh wă kơ nhôn iŏk sa jên iĕm thoi lu sư, wă kơ lu sư gơh pơang khan lu sư jang lei-lăi thoi nhôn, mă-lei nhôn ưh kơ đei layơ wă iŏk sa jên iĕm ôh.

English: For such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ.
Bahnar: Iĕm ngêh kơ lu bơngai noh pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist tơpă hă? Ưh ôh. Lu sư hơlĕnh dêh ưh kơ đei layơ tơpăt, chă pôk pơang pơ'brơh kơ akâu kơdih đĕch khan pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist.

English: And no wonder! For Satan himself transforms himself into an angel of light.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh iĕm 'nĕ lăng hlĭch tơdrong kiơ, lu sư trŏ kơ khŭl yang Satan 'mơ̆i. Yang Satan phŏ sư kư̆m pơm thoi linh jang 'lơ̆ng.

English: Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also transform themselves into ministers of righteousness, whose end will be according to their works.
Bahnar: Na mă jơ̆ng 'bang sư chă pơpơm thoi bơngai 'lơ̆ng, iĕm 'nĕ lăng hlĭch tơdrong kiơ; yua kơ dôm tơdrong lu sư pơm kơnê̆ noh, lu sư ưh kơ klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong hiong răm.

English: I say again, let no one think me a fool. If otherwise, at least receive me as a fool, that I also may boast a little.
Bahnar: Inh wă tơbăt dơ̆ng kơ iĕm thoi âu: Iĕm 'nĕ tơchĕng khan inh bơngai kơhlôh tơpă, mă-lei dah iĕm wă jô̆ kơ inh pơm thoi bơngai kơhlôh kư̆m bưh mơ̆n wă kơ inh gơh pơang akâu thoi lu bơngai pơjăm inh noh 'biơ̆.

English: What I speak, I speak not according to the Lord, but as it were, foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.
Bahnar: Tơdrong inh wă pơma pơang akâu inh dang ei, ưh kơ sĭ pơma rok thoi Kră Yang Yêsu ôh, inh pơma thoi bơngai kơhlôh na inh pơ̆n pơma pơang akâu kơdih.

English: Seeing that many boast according to the flesh, I also will boast.
Bahnar: Dang ei đei lơ bơngai pơma pơang akâu kơdih kiơ̆ thoi lu bơngai ưh kơ lui, na inh kư̆m wă pơma rok lu sư 'biơ̆.

English: For you put up with fools gladly, since you yourselves are wise!
Bahnar: Lu iĕm bơngai hơgei dêh boih dah kiơ, na mă iĕm chu mơ̆ng dôm lu bơngai kơhlôh pơma kư̆ kă thoi noh?

English: For you put up with it if one brings you into bondage, if one devours you, if one takes from you, if one exalts himself, if one strikes you on the face.
Bahnar: Iĕm chu kơ lu bơngai noh, iĕm jing bơngai đĭch; sư sa yua kơpah tơmam iĕm, sư pơgŏ iĕm, iĕm chu sư pơjuă kơtĭt iĕm, sư tap 'bŏ iĕm.

English: To our shame I say that we were too weak for that! But in whatever anyone is bold—I speak foolishly—I am bold also.
Bahnar: Lu sư jô̆ kơ inh khan bơngai rơdu, trŏ boih yua kơ inh ưh kơ pơ̆n pơm thoi noh ôh. Na dang ei inh chă pơma kơ iĕm kư̆ kă thoi bơngai kơhlôh kơbăt na đe pơang akâu thoi yơ, inh kư̆m pơang thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? So am I.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh bơngai Hêbrơ hă? Inh kư̆m bơngai Hêbrơ. Lu bơngai noh bơngai Isơrael hă? Inh kư̆m bơngai Isơrael. Lu sư kon sâu Abraham hă? Inh kư̆m kon sâu 'bok noh.

English: Are they ministers of Christ?—I speak as a fool—I am more: in labors more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequently, in deaths often.
Bahnar: Lu sư đĭch đam Yêsu Krist hă? Inh wă pơma pơang thoi bơngai kơhlôh dơ̆ng: Inh jang 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ lu sư, inh jang hrat hloh kơ lu sư, đe tah inh tơ hnam phak lơ 'măng hloh kơ lu sư, đe tach pơjĭ inh lơ 'măng hloh kơ lu sư, lơ 'măng inh jĭ truh kơ wă lôch.

English: From the Jews five times I received forty stripes minus one.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê teh pơjĭ inh păng sơnguĕt pơđăm 'măng boih, rim 'măng sư teh pêng-jĭt tơsĭn wơ̆t.

English: Three times I was beaten with rods; once I was stoned; three times I was shipwrecked; a night and a day I have been in the deep
Bahnar: Pêng 'măng đe tôn teh inh păng 'long tơnôn pah băl, minh 'măng đe klơ̆m păng tơmo, pêng 'măng hao thŏng-nan, thŏng-nan krăm, minh măng minh năr oei tơ kơpal đak dơsĭ.

English: in journeys often, in perils of waters, in perils of robbers, in perils of my own countrymen, in perils of the Gentiles, in perils in the city, in perils in the wilderness, in perils in the sea, in perils among false brethren
Bahnar: Inh bơngai juăt kơ brŏk năm ataih, hơmơt hli kơ glơ̆k tơ đak krong, hơmơt hli kơ lu bơngai brơ̆t răp tơtông, hli kơ tơduă lu bôl nhôn kơdih bơngai Juđê hil areh, hli kơ lu bơngai nai kư̆m hil areh, hli kơ lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei tih păng hơmơt kơ yak rok trong bri brah, hơmơt kơ glơ̆k tơ đak dơsĭ, hơmơt kơ lu bơngai ưh kơ lui hơlĕnh pơm bơngai lui.

English: in weariness and toil, in sleeplessness often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness
Bahnar: Inh jang gleh đei lơ tơdrong truh pơmat-tat. Phŏ kral kơmăng pă tep, phŏ pơngot hang klak rơhing kơ đak ưh kơ đei, năr jơ̆l kơ tơmam sa ưh kơ đei kư̆m đei, tơngiĕt tơngiot oei akâu hoh kư̆m đei.

English: besides the other things, what comes upon me daily: my deep concern for all the churches.
Bahnar: Păng đon tơchĕng rim năr hli kơ lu bơngai lui đei tơdrong gleh kư̆m pha 'mơ̆i.

English: Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is made to stumble, and I do not burn with indignation?
Bahnar: Hăm 'bôh bu lui rơdu mă inh ưh kơ mơnat? Hăm 'bôh bu huŏng lăm tơdrong yoch đe pơhlŭ mă inh ưh kơ sơ'ngon?

English: If I must boast, I will boast in the things which concern my infirmity.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r inh dang pơang akâu kơdih mă inh pơang akâu inh bơngai tơrăn đe pơmat.

English: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed forever, knows that I am not lying.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei 'Bă Yŏng bơ̆n Yêsu Krist, Sư trŏ kơ bơ̆n ư-ang ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch, Sư băt kơ inh pơma ưh kơ hơlĕnh.

English: In Damascus the governor, under Aretas the king, was guarding the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desiring to arrest me
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Đamas sơ̆ đei minh 'nu pơm phŏ pơtao Arêtah, sư athei đe gak 'măng tơm Đamas, tơ̆ng 'bôh inh athei rôp.

English: but I was let down in a basket through a window in the wall, and escaped from his hands.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu 'nhŏng oh bôl buăl inh tah inh lăm bai tơjur inh trong 'măng-'mŏk jih dur pơlei, na lu 'bok noh huay kơ rôp inh, inh jăk hloi tơ nai.

English: It is doubtless not profitable for me to boast. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord
Bahnar: Inh dang wă roi pơang kơ iĕm dơ̆ng, tơdrong ưh kơ yua ră, mă-lei inh dang wă roi pơang kơ iĕm tơdrong Kră Yang tơ'bôh kơ minh 'nu bơngai.

English: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago—whether in the body I do not know, or whether out of the body I do not know, God knows—such a one was caught up to the third heaven.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh sư kư̆m lui kơ Yêsu Krist. Lăm minh 'măng mơjĭt-puăn sơnăm hơdrol sơ̆, 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk sư truh tơ anih 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti, ưh kơ băt atŏk hăm akâu sư hloi, dah atŏk bơhngol sư đĕch; tơdrong noh inh kư̆m ưh kơ băt tơpă, 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch băt.

English: And I know such a man—whether in the body or out of the body I do not know, God knows
Bahnar: Mă inh băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk sư tơ Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng tơpă, mă tơdrong atŏk akâu sư dah bơhngol sư noh inh ưh kơ băt.

English: how he was caught up into Paradise and heard inexpressible words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk sư wă kơ sư 'bôh tơdrong mă tam kơtơ̆ng, tơdrong kon bơngai ưh kơ pơ̆n pơma.

English: Of such a one I will boast; yet of myself I will not boast, except in my infirmities.
Bahnar: Inh wă pơang bơngai noh mơ̆n, mă inh ưh kơ pơ̆n pơang dêh, inh wă pơang akâu inh kơtul tơrăn đĕch trŏ.

English: For though I might desire to boast, I will not be a fool; for I will speak the truth. But I refrain, lest anyone should think of me above what he sees me to be or hears from me.
Bahnar: Mă tơ̆ng inh pơang kơ iĕm tơdrong noh kơbĭ pơkiơ ră, yua kơ tơdrong tơpă, mă inh hli kơ đe ư-ang tơdrong bơngai noh 'bôh păng kơtơ̆ng, dang lĕ pơang akâu inh kơdih. Inh wă kơ đe 'bôh păng kơtơ̆ng dôm tơdrong bơngai noh hmă đĕch.

English: And lest I should be exalted above measure by the abundance of the revelations, a thorn in the flesh was given to me, a messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I be exalted above measure.
Bahnar: Yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kuă ăn inh pơang kơ iĕm tơdrong noh, na dang ei inh đei tơdrong nhek nhek dang jơla trŏ akar, yang Satan pơm kơ inh.

English: Concerning this thing I pleaded with the Lord three times that it might depart from me.
Bahnar: Pêng 'măng boih inh apinh Kră Yang pơklaih inh đơ̆ng tơdrong âu.

English: And He said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for My strength is made perfect in weakness.” Therefore most gladly I will rather boast in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Sư khan: “Huay ôh, ih kư̆ kơ jang tơdrong Inh mă tơpă đĕch, tơdrong ih jang ưh kơ kĕ ưh kơ pran noh lê̆ kơ Inh tơgŭm ih, ih 'nĕ hiơ̆k kơ tơdrong ih pơmat-tat noh, thoi noh na đe băt kơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Inh tih tơpă, ih pơmat-tat dang noh mă oei jang khŏm khŏm.” Thoi noh na dang ei inh kuă boih pơang kơ iĕm tơdrong noh, pơang pơăi tơdrong inh kơtul tơrăn đĕch na Sư ăn kơ inh hiôk gơh jang tơdrong Sư khŏm khŏm.

English: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in needs, in persecutions, in distresses, for Christ’s sake. For when I am weak, then I am strong.
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh wă pơư pơang anăn Yêsu Krist, na inh đei tơdrong rơdu tơrăn, đei tơdrong đe pơjăm, đei tơdrong gleh truh, tơdrong đe pơm pơmat inh, tơdrong anat anot, mă-lei jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk rai pran.

English: I have become a fool in boasting; you have compelled me. For I ought to have been commended by you; for in nothing was I behind the most eminent apostles, though I am nothing.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ iĕm rai wă hiơt kơ inh bơngai mă pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist, na inh đei pơma pơang kơ iĕm thoi noh, dang bơngai wơnh, dang bơngai kư̆ kă. Lu bơngai noh chă pơpơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist, lu sư khan lu sư bơngai hơgei dêh mă-lei inh ưh kơ thuơ, mă khan inh bơngai kơtul.

English: Truly the signs of an apostle were accomplished among you with all perseverance, in signs and wonders and mighty deeds.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh oei hơdai iĕm sơ̆, inh adrin jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, iĕm kư̆m 'bôh lơ tơdrong inh tơbăt kơ iĕm inh pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist păng iĕm kư̆m 'bôh lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang hlĭch hlăch tơpă.

English: For what is it in which you were inferior to other churches, except that I myself was not burdensome to you? Forgive me this wrong!
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang inh oei tơ iĕm kư̆m lei-lăi thoi inh jang tơ anih nai; pôm tơdrong 'me sa inh đĕch, inh kuă kơ pơgleh iĕm athei iĕm 'me inh, mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ jô̆ yo.

English: Now for the third time I am ready to come to you. And I will not be burdensome to you; for I do not seek yours, but you. For the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.
Bahnar: Na 'măng mă pêng âu inh wă năm tơ iĕm, mă inh năm inh ưh kơ năm pơgleh iĕm athei iĕm 'me inh, dah iŏk jên tơmam iĕm ôh; inh năm tơ iĕm, inh wă ngôi hơpong păng iĕm. Ưh kơ sĭ kon 'me 'bă ôh, 'bă 'me kon.

English: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for your souls; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I am loved.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m hiôk mơ̆n mă inh pơhuach jên tơmam pơlap akâu kơdih yua kơ inh wă kơ iĕm lui kơjăp. Inh 'mêm kơ iĕm tơpă, bĭ iĕm ưh pă 'mêm kơ inh boih hă?

English: But be that as it may, I did not burden you. Nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you by cunning!
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei iĕm băt tơpă boih, inh ưh kơ wă kơ iĕm 'me inh; inh pơma thoi noh mă-lei iĕm khan noh inh pơma pơlung iĕm wă kơ inh gơh iŏk jên tơmam iĕm tơ nai hă?

English: Did I take advantage of you by any of those whom I sent to you?
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai inh wơh năm tơ iĕm, lu sư hăm đei pơlung iŏk jên tơmam iĕm? Ưh kơ đei ôh.

English: I urged Titus, and sent our brother with him. Did Titus take advantage of you? Did we not walk in the same spirit? Did we not walk in the same steps?
Bahnar: Inh wơh Tĭt hăm minh 'nu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n năm tơ iĕm ki, Tĭt hăm đei pơhlŭ iŏk tơmam iĕm? Ưh ôh, yua kơ nhi bơ̆jang minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon hơdai.

English: Again, do you think that we excuse ourselves to you? We speak before God in Christ. But we do all things, beloved, for your edification.
Bahnar: Iĕm tơchĕng nhôn chih đơ̆ng tơm hmơm hei, truh tơ dang ei âu, iĕm tơchĕng nhôn chih athei iĕm pơma sek tơlang tơdrong nhôn hă? Ưh ôh. Tơdrong sek tơlang, bơ̆n gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang đĕch păng gô mơ̆ng kơ Yêsu Krist đĕch tơgŭm nhôn pơma. Ơ 'nhŏng oh mă nhôn 'mêm kơeng, dôm tơdrong nhôn chih bơtho iĕm noh hei ưh kơ sĭ nhôn hil kơ iĕm ôh, nhôn wă kơ iĕm lui kơjăp.

English: For I fear lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I wish, and that I shall be found by you such as you do not wish; lest there be contentions, jealousies, outbursts of wrath, selfish ambitions, backbitings, whisperings, conceits, tumults
Bahnar: Inh hli kơ mưh năr inh truh tơ iĕm, iĕm ưh kơ lui kơjăp kiơ̆ thoi đon inh wă. Mă iĕm 'bôh inh iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ hiôk yua kơ iĕm hli kơ inh hil kơ iĕm. Păng inh hli kơ iĕm pơjah pơjăng dih băl, tơgar sa băl, tơhil băl, kret kuă kơ asong băl, pơjăm bôl buăl, bâu roi bôl buăl, pơang akâu kơdih păng hli kơ iĕm akŭm ưh kơ trŏ.

English: lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and I shall mourn for many who have sinned before and have not repented of the uncleanness, fornication, and lewdness which they have practiced.
Bahnar: Inh hli kơ mưh inh truh tơ noh, 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ inh mơlâu hmoi ơh akâu kơdih yua kơ lu iĕm mơ'nah lui đunh boih mă oei pơm yoch hơnơ̆ng ưh kơ băt tơbral kơdih dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, dôm tơdrong kư̆ kă iĕm pơm.

English: This will be the third time I am coming to you. “By the mouth of two or three witnesses every word shall be established.”
Bahnar: Wă pêng 'măng kơ âu boih inh năm tơ iĕm, mă-lei ưh kơ sĭ năm chă jâu đe kư̆ kă ôh; tơ̆ng 'bar pêng 'nu 'bôh sư pơm yoch tơpă, na gơh pơma kơ sư.

English: I have told you before, and foretell as if I were present the second time, and now being absent I write to those who have sinned before, and to all the rest, that if I come again I will not spare
Bahnar: Inh năm tơ iĕm 'măng mă 'bar ki, inh khan kơ lu bơngai pơm yoch hăm lu bơngai nai, mưh inh năm tơ iĕm pă 'măng 'bôh iĕm oei pơm yoch, inh ưh pă bơtho boih, inh tơlĕch lê̆ hloi; na mă inh oei krŭl đơ̆ng iĕm dang ei inh kư̆m khan kơ iĕm thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: since you seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, who is not weak toward you, but mighty in you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na kơnh pơgê iĕm gô băt kơ Yêsu Krist yua 'bơ̆r inh pơma kơ iĕm. Sư ưh kơ rơdu kơ iĕm ôh, Sư jang lăm lu iĕm kơtang tơpă.

English: For though He was crucified in weakness, yet He lives by the power of God. For we also are weak in Him, but we shall live with Him by the power of God toward you.
Bahnar: Sư lôch tơ 'long pơglang sơ̆ kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, bơ̆n lăng Sư lôch thoi Sư rơdu, mă-lei Sư đei mơsêh mơyang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơtang, ăn kơ Sư iung arih dơ̆ng. Nhôn kư̆m rơdu tơrăn thoi Sư sơ̆, mă-lei nhôn đei mơsêh mơyang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơtang, tơdrong arih nhôn năm tơ iĕm kơnh kư̆m thoi noh.

English: Examine yourselves as to whether you are in the faith. Test yourselves. Do you not know yourselves, that Jesus Christ is in you?—unless indeed you are disqualified.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei pơlong lăng tơdrong arih iĕm, hăm thoi bơngai lui tơpă dah ưh. Iĕm hăm băt kơ Yêsu Krist oei hơdai iĕm? Hli kơ iĕm ưh kơ lui kơ Sư đĕch, na Sư ưh kơ oei hơdai iĕm.

English: But I trust that you will know that we are not disqualified.
Bahnar: Iĕm băt kơ Yêsu Krist oei hơdai iĕm, iĕm kư̆m băt kơ Yêsu Krist oei hơdai nhôn mơ̆n mă đơ̆ng nhôn bơtho iĕm sơ̆.

English: Now I pray to God that you do no evil, not that we should appear approved, but that you should do what is honorable, though we may seem disqualified.
Bahnar: Nhôn krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm iĕm huay kơ pơm yoch, na đe gô băt kơ nhôn gơh tơgŭm iĕm yua kơ Yêsu Krist oei hơdai nhôn. Mă-lei nhôn ưh kơ gan kăl kơ đe băt tơdrong noh ôh. Nhôn krao khan kơ Sư wă kơ Sư tơgŭm iĕm đĕch. Tơ̆ng iĕm pơm 'lơ̆ng, nhôn truh tơ noh, nhôn ưh pă kăl kơ bơtho iĕm boih păng nhôn kư̆m ưh pă kăl kơ tơbăt kơ iĕm nhôn jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist.

English: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng iĕm pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt boih, nhôn kư̆m ưh pă gơh bơtho iĕm thoi yơ dơ̆ng, nhôn pôm pơthim tơdrong rai 'lơ̆ng đĕch.

English: For we are glad when we are weak and you are strong. And this also we pray, that you may be made complete.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng iĕm lui kơjăp, nhôn kư̆m rơdu mơ̆n ưh kơ pơm kơtang ôh, nhôn rai 'nă hal kơ iĕm lui kơjăp. Thoi noh na dang ei nhôn krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm iĕm, wă kơ iĕm jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt lăm tôm tơdrong.

English: Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the authority which the Lord has given me for edification and not for destruction.
Bahnar: Âu kơplah inh oei krŭl na inh chih kơ iĕm thoi noh, wă kơ mưh inh truh tơ iĕm, inh huay pă kăl kơ bơtho iĕm boih. Tơdrong bơtho noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang Yêsu Krist ăn kơ inh, wă kơ inh bơtho iĕm thoi noh, wă kơ inh tơgŭm iĕm rai đunh rai lui kơjăp; ưh kơ sĭ wă pơglăi iĕm ôh.

English: Finally, brethren, farewell. Become complete. Be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace will be with you.
Bahnar: Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, dôm tơdrong inh chă chih kơ iĕm dôm noh boih. Oei kơ iĕm mă 'lơ̆ng. Adrin pơm 'lơ̆ng, mơ̆ng dôm tơdrong inh pơma, băt chu dih băl, oei sa hiôk chơt; thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei mă 'mêm mơnat kơ kon bơngai hăm ăn kon bơngai hiôk-hian, Sư gô oei hơdai iĕm.

English: Greet one another with a holy kiss.
Bahnar: Apinh iĕm ngôi hơpong 'mêm dih băl mă 'lơ̆ng, yua kơ đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n 'nhŏng oh lui kơ Yêsu Krist.

English: All the saints greet you.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ lu kon 'Bok Kei-Dei mă oei tơ nhôn kư̆m hơdai đei nơ̆r jet gia iĕm. Nhôn apinh Kră Yang Yêsu Krist, đon băt mơnat, wei-lăng iĕm lăm tôm tơdrong; 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang mă 'mêm kơeng kơ bơ̆n, Sư gô tơgŭm iĕm ling-lang; Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, Sư kư̆m oei hơdai hăm iĕm khŏm khŏm.
